forumNotes.content:
Hello,   
I have three hard drives and five OS's installed as follows  
SATA1: WinXP32, Vista32, Ubuntu 7.22  
SATA2: Vista 64  
IDE (slave to DVD RW) XP64  
I installed the OS's in the order listed.  
I disconnected SATA 1 and the IDE hard drive when I intalled Vista64 on SATA2 so I have to go through BIOS to access Vista 64  
I disconnected the SATA drives when I installed XP64 on the slave IDE drive, so I now have to go through BIOS also to access XP64.  
Is there a way to edit Boot.ini to include the two 64-bit operating systems and not have to go through BIOS?  
Thank you in advance for any assistance on this one.
